intro: Hybanthus mexicanus subsp. pilosus, commonly known as the hairy hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is a member of the bindweed family, Convolvulaceae, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with five lobes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in sunny, well-drained habitats and is often found in dry grasslands or rocky areas.
